Nick Gall wrote:
> Is the 
> problem the fact that the PUT request is not providing a representation 
> for the resource (eg an XML document), but is only providing a URL to 
> the representation (via the x-amz-copy-source header)?

That does make it not do what the spec says PUT does.

Me, I'd be perfectly happy to see it PUT a resource like <copyFrom 
xmlns="http://amazon.com/someAmazonDefinedNamespace" 
href="/sourcebucket/sourceObject" /> and have the server "know" that 
this represents a resource that would be best represented with a copy of 
the current representation of /sourcebucket/sourceObject and do the 
requested copy.

Other people will disagree (previous debate on the semantics of PUT gets 
regurgitated here).
